intro: Chorizanthe biloba var. immemora, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually linear and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is known for its drought tolerance and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
